instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-02020: What is 820-02020? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CD3217: What is CD3217? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook won’t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook won’t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: 820 02020 usb data line not working
threads.message:
hello guys, 

I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board with a little bit of water damage. 
The MacBook I got was booting but without backlight. I replaced UC300 because was missing <SIGNAL>P5VS2_BST</SIGNAL> for powering the backlight driver and that issues is fixed. 

The MacBook is now  working and charging. The only remaining problem is the usb activity that is not there. Anything else looks clean and I don't know what to check to fix this problem. any suggestion ?

threads.title: 820 02020 usb data line not working
threads.message:
The problem persists on both port, in both connection ways?
Do you get 5V at external USB device?

threads.title: 820 02020 usb data line not working
threads.message:
The problem persists on both port, in both connection ways? Yes
Do you get 5V at external USB device? No

threads.title: 820 02020 usb data line not working
threads.message: Did fix the issue replacing <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP>. In most of the model that chip is the issue right? because I have a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with that problem too.

threads.title: 820 02020 usb data line not working
threads.message:
Depends of exact symptom.
Sometime USB device is recognized on start-up, but not once macOS is loaded; then the big TBT cjip is the culprit.

Old models have separate circuit to provide 5V to external USB device; which fails a lot on 2016/17 models (GAV/GAY chips).

threads.title: 820 02020 usb data line not working
threads.message:
i have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with only the upper usb port, both sides, doesn't read the data line.
So, 
The problem persists on both port, in both connection ways? NO
Do you get 5V at external USB device? No

Is this a <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> issue too?
